mbr_id.$comment: also partitionId for container; NOTE: sysName should not render down to any boolean version of false

parent_id.description: parent id of avatar, can be a core member avatar or any sub-object in system, as referenced by uuid alone

assistant.$comment: this could become an array of assistants, with `type` going away

being.description: root constructor for avatar/agent in MyLife

categories.$comment: Categories for any construct (i.e., not just avatars) are dynamically built by LLM and assigned/inherited on creation, spokes of the wheel of contextualization

contributions.description: array of contributions to avatar, not distinct to single core, contributions could be applied to keys (whether adding/updating) inside _any_ object
contributions.$comment: 20231202 limiting to 3 contributions per avatar, as it will be simpler to check, and mechanic _could_ be too costly to scale, and by time of scale likely to have a better solution

context.default: This avatar was auto-generated by the MyLife system on file creation date to fulfill MyLife's member contract with this member (anonymously identified by `mbr_id`)
context.description: avatar context: describes how avatar is used in the uber-context of MyLife
context.$comment: might describe the history of the avatar, or the context in which it was created, used, was successful, to whome it spoke, etc.

name.$comment: may ultimately be removed in favor of `names` array

items.$comment: will convert name to `name` object ultimately, should be independent file, as it can be applied to many (if not all) objects

names.$comment: Can item contents reference the schema of the name property?

messages.description: array of openai messages for avatar
messages.$comment: NOTE: actually belongs in session, but here would only capture messages in active thread

type.$comment: In attempt to make assistants more modular, define external system type here, and then add optional data-elements from appropriate sub_assistant type

being.description: root constructor for contribution in MyLife

contribution.description: contribution content of suggestion to underlying object [object_id]
contribution.$comment: **note**: will certainly sophisticate itself, but for now, just a string, and contribution-agent (known to underlying object) will be responsible for parsing and applying to underlying object [object_id]; could also attach file of JSON, develop new object, etc.

key.description: key (JSON-data-point) suggested or known of underlying object [object_id] to which contribution is being suggested

mbr_id.$comment: also partitionId for container; NOTE: sysName should not render down to any boolean version of false

object_id.description: parent id of contribution, can be anything _but_ an agent or avatar, to avoid recursion and unnecessary meta-complexity

object_being.description: type of object to which contribution is being made
